column4: someone here that can explain me how to let multiple programs use the sound at the same time, or is this impossible????
!sound

I found a quick and easy solution that might work for you is to run programs with "aoss"... try installing the package "alsa-oss" and the running commands like "aoss firefox". But check with ubotu's solution first.
actually which 'file' in /dev is for alsamixer
not what i ment
i mean, like i have amarok (using ALSA) and GNOME, also using also, when i listen to music using amarok, GNOME won't be able to play sounds
or anyone else: do you know a way to fix this
Mmm... Soooounds like you're using OSS instead of alsa. Try working with Alsa.... Ubuntu said something to you when you typed !sound
no OSS here, everything is using ALSA
That second link Ubotu sent might be of more help than I am.
I remember having problems like that a while back... are you on < 6.06?
installed this one 12 days go, newest iso, installed all updates, so, no
Ouch. I'm sorry man, I'm not real good on sound problems.
which file is for ALSA, i'll try to manually set it to ALSA, to make absolutly sure it is using ALSA
I've had problems with some programs not using ALSA... You said its amarok and gnome right? Try installing "alsa-oss" (apt-get install alsa-oss) and running amarok with "aoss amarok"
nevermind, altough it was set to ALSA it was still using OSS
Alternatively, make sure that Amarok's using Alsa.
Haha :P Worst case if you ever get programs that won't use anything BUT OSS, you can use aoss.
now i've found the real problem
Mmm?
in the sound setting it's set to ALSA but using OSS, i've set it to OSS, and back to ALSA, and everything works :D
Horay!
anyway, thanks
